resources.string: CrimeMap is an interactive app that allows users to view real crime data supplied from the Queensland Police Service.
The aim is to allow users to be as informed as possible while they\'re looking for new areas to relocate in Queensland.
Map data was supplied by Open Street Map.
Crime data was provided by the Queensland Police Service - ©State of Queensland ( QPS ) 2016
CrimeMap was created with Android Studio 2.3.

Search 
 - Input a suburb within Queensland that you would like to gather data for. 
 
 Filter
 - Opens the filter page to select offence types to display. 
 
 Menu
 - Opens the menu to navigate to other pages. 
 
 GPS
 - Performs a search on your current location. 
 
 Area Statistics
 - Opens the statistics page which displays data on graphs.

Time Period 
 - The time period can range from 1 week up to 5 years from the current date. 

 Offence Types 
 - Choose which offences are displayed. 

 Confirm 
 - Updates the current search.

Locations 
 - Input different suburbs to compare offence statistics.

 Comparison Results 
 - Data will be displayed on a line graph over the time specified in the filter. Bar graphs will display data by offence type for each suburb.

Offence Marker 
 - Clicking on a blue offence marker will display the offence details. 

 Offence Information 
 - Displays the offence type, date, and current status.

Individual Offence Markers are colour-coded based on the severity of the offence. 

 White Shield 
 - Low severity for an offence. 

 Yellow Shield /n - Medium severity for an offence. 

 Red Shield /n - High severity for an offence.

Cluster Offence Markers are colour-coded based on how many individual offences have occurred at that location. 

 Green Marker 
 - 10 or less offences. 

 Yellow Marker 
 - Between 10 and 20 offences.

 Red Marker 
 - 20 or more offences.
